answers.answer: Frequent belching (with  a shoulder "twinge") may be due to:- Helycobacter pylori infection of the stomach (nausea, early satiety, belching, upper abdominal bloating). Dx is with breath test.- Slow stomach emptying from various reasons: hypothyroidism, impared nerves in long term diabetes, obstruction of the stomach exit (fibrosis due to an ulcer in this area). Dx is with stomach emptying test.- Small intestinal bacterial overgrowth (SIBO). This would probably appear with bloating, diarrhea or constipation. Dx is with a breath test.Bloated stomach or a part of intestine may press upon the diaphragm what could cause left shoulder pain.If you also have right upper abdominal pain..it could be the gallbladder.
